name: Sail Inn B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it was a while ago when we stayed there (August 2007) I just wanted to write a quick review to let people know how wonderful it was.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 1 which was very large and had nice antique furnishings and a huge bathroom with jacuzzi. There was also a little kitchenette.
reviews.title: Four Star Accomodations, Five Star Experience

likes.liked: — Going with Keith on his boats.

reviews.title: Good B&B and Complementary Sail Too!
reviews.text: Since the owner's boat (The Eastern Star) wasn't filled we went out with them for an afternoon cruise and then an evening/sunset cruise (it was free since they weren't full). We brought a bottle of wine and a little picnic to enjoy. My husband even helped to raise the sails. There were binoculars on board and we saw seals.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Sail Inn B& B. We stayed in room #2 & loved it. Very spacious & clean with good amenities. The location was great...just one street up from where the Bluenose II is berthed. We truly enjoyed the sail although there was no wind. We had the option of sitting out in the harbour or using the motor to go out by the Ovens. We went to the Ovens. Breakfast was very good with lots of options....eggs, sausage, bacon, breads, fruit, cheeses, jams, etc. Would def stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Stay & Sail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sail Inn on our second night in Lunenburg and we were soooo happy we had to switch Inns. Lovely room, beautifully restored building, wonderful complimentary sail on the owner's boat and the hugest, most delicious breakfast we had on our trip! Please stay here. You will love it! (ask for room #4).
reviews.title: THE BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we loved the sail inn. really friendly people, yummy, cooked to order breakfast, spacious, homey room, great view, amazing "free sail" included in the cost of the room. we LOVED it and would return in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: the best b & b ever!!!

likes.liked: — the free sail included, breakfast, wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just called in on spec and found a real bargain! The owner also has a 48 foot classic wooden ketch (Eastern Star) that conducts interpreted sails around the harbour and bay. If you stay at this lovingly restored turn of the century skipper's house you will be invited aboard the ketch for an evening sail. The four rooms are all spacious and thoughtfully restored to enhance many of the building's original features. The decor is contemporary whilst complementing the old building. The breakfast was excellent, with healthy options.
reviews.title: Free Sail!

likes.disliked: — Having to leave the next day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sail Inn B&B in Lunenburg after staying at the Guest Lovitt B&B in Yarmouth. The Sail Inn is a very different yet complementary experience and one you should not miss. Again, the location is excellent as it is right down town and has a view of the harbour. We stayed in room # 3 on the third floor with a small kitchenette but the highlight of the room is the very large bathroom with jaquzzi. The breakfast by the owner Keith, was made to order with a variety of items that would satisfy all tastes. (I especially enjoyed the salted salmon.)
reviews.title: Stay at the Sail Inn B&B!

aka: Sail Inn B&B Lunenburg, Nova Scotia
